facts.general-house-cleaning: General house cleaning is the process of cleaning the house
facts.quick-or-thorough: Quick cleaning is the process of cleaning the house quickly. Thorough cleaning is the process of cleaning the house thoroughly
facts.quick-cleaning: Quick cleaning is the process of cleaning the house or a specific room quickly
facts.thorough-cleaning: Thorough cleaning is the process of cleaning the house or a specific room thoroughly
facts.room-options: Room options are the rooms in the house
facts.living-room: The main room in the house
facts.kitchen: The place where food is prepared
facts.bathroom: The place where people bathe and relieve themselves
facts.stains: A substance that is difficult to remove
facts.mixed-food: A food that is both liquid and solid
facts.floors: A horizontal structure used to separate rooms
facts.floor-tiles: A hard floor covering made from multiple pieces
facts.laminate-flooring: A hard floor covering similar to plastic
facts.walls: A vertical structure used to separate rooms
facts.wall-tiles: A covering for walls made from multiple pieces
facts.paint-wall: A covering for walls made from paint
facts.wooden-wall: A covering for walls made from wood
facts.brick-wall: A covering for walls made from bricks
facts.furniture: A movable object used for sitting or sleeping
facts.fabric-furniture: A material used for furniture with a unique texture
facts.leather-furniture: A material used for furniture made from animal skin
facts.wood-furniture: A material used for furniture made from trees
facts.metal-furniture: A material used for furniture made from metal
facts.glass-furniture: A material used for furniture made from glass
facts.plastic-furniture: A material used for furniture made from plastic

outputs.general-quick-living-room: For the living-room, first declutter and clean up all non-essential objects in the livingroom. Then dust the general surfaces. Vacuum and the the floors.
outputs.general-thorough-living-room: For the living-room, first declutter and clean up all non-essential objects in the livingroom. Then dust the general surfaces. Use a vacuum cleaner with a special brush to clean between the gaps and the surface of the sofa. Use a soft, dry cloth to dust the TV. With a damp cloth dust the TV cabinet, table, sidetables.  Vacuum and then mop the floors.
outputs.general-quick-kitchen: For the kitchen, declutter and clean up all non-essential objects in the room. From the fridge and the freezer, remove all things past their due date. Clean the kitchen cabinets and the counter with a cloth using all-purpose cleaner, finish by wiping with a dry cloth. Clean the sink using the scour side of a scouring-sponge and SCHUURMIDDEL. For the tap, use ANTIKALK, use the scour side of a scouring-sponge. Rinse off the ANTIKALK and dry using a dry cloth. For the stove, use an all-purpose cleaner and the scour side of a scouring sponge. For persistent stains use degreaser. Finish wiping off with a dry cloth. Vacuum the kitchen to finish.
outputs.general-thorough-kitchen: For the kitchen, declutter and clean up all non-essential objects in the room. Start with the freezer. For the freezer, remove the plug and put a kitchen towel in front, on the floor, open the door of the freezer and remove all items. You can put this in a COOLBAG??? Put a few pans with hot water inside. Close the door. Wait a while. Clean the kitchen cabinets, especially the handles, and the counter with a cloth using all-purpose cleaner, finish by wiping with a dry cloth. Clean the sink using the scour side of a scouring-sponge and SCHUURMIDDEL. For the tap, use ANTIKALK, use the scour side of a scouring-sponge. Rinse off the ANTIKALK and dry using a dry cloth. For the stove, use an all-purpose cleaner and the scour side of a scouring pad. For persistent stains use degreaser. Finish wiping off with a dry cloth. For the hood, remove the detachable elements. If possible, you can put them in the dishwasher. If this does not fit, clean them using a degreaser and the dishwashing brush. Rinse off and let dry. For the oven, use a degreaser and the soft side of a scouring sponge. For the outside of the oven door, you can use a glass cleaner. For the inside of the oven door, you can still use degreaser. For the dishwasher, clean out the detachable filters. For the refrigerator, remove all elements past their due date. Remove all detachable elements and wash them off using dishssoap. The inside of the refrigerator can be cleaned using a cloth and allpurpose cleaner. Afterwards make it dry with a dry cloth. For the detachable elements, you can dry them off and put them back. Now, back to the freezer. Open the door. Remove the pans and look whether the ice has melted. Put a catcher in the freezer that can catch ice. Then use a SCRAPER? to remove excess ice. Dry the freezer using a dry cloth. Clean the rubber parts of the door using dishssoap. Put the plug back into its socket! Return all items into the freezer. Close the door. Remove the kitchentowel from the floor. For the coffeemachine, ONTKALK once every three months using a ONTKALKER for your coffeemachine, this can be machine dependent. Some machines don't need to be ONTKALKT. For the kettle, use ONTKALKER for the kettle. Once evry three months. To finish, vacuum and mop the kitchen.
outputs.general-quick-bedroom: For the bedroom, first declutter and clean up all non-essential objects in the room. Change the sheets of the bed. Dust the cabinets and lamps with a damp cloth and allpurpose cleaner. Vacuum, also under the bed.
outputs.general-thorough-bedroom: For the bedroom, first declutter and clean up all non-essential objects in the room. Change the sheets of the bed. Dust the cabinets and lamps with a damp cloth and allpurpose cleaner. Vacuum, also under the bed. Mop the bedroom to finish.
outputs.general-quick-bathroom: The bathroom first needs to be decluttered and all non-essential objects in the room need to be removed. For the shower, spray ANTIKALK everywhere in the shower. For the joints, use the scour side of a scouring sponge. Rinse with water. Use a wiper to move all the water to the drain. Clean the drain of the shower. Clean the sink using the scour side of a scouring-sponge and SCHUURMIDDEL. For the tap, use ANTIKALK, use the scour side of a scouring-sponge. Rinse off the ANTIKALK and dry using a dry cloth. For the toilet, use toiletcleaner and use the brush to scrob. Flush the toilet. Use a damp cloth with allpurpose cleaner to wipe the seat. Use a dry cloth to dry the surfaces.
outputs.general-thorough-bathroom: The bathroom first needs to be decluttered and all non-essential objects in the room need to be removed. For the shower, spray ANTIKALK everywhere in the shower. For the joints, use the scour side of a scouring sponge. Rinse with water. Use a wiper to move all the water to the drain. Clean the drain of the shower. Clean the sink using the scour side of a scouring-sponge and SCHUURMIDDEL. For the tap, use ANTIKALK, use the scour side of a scouring-sponge. Rinse off the ANTIKALK and dry using a dry cloth. For the toilet, use toiletcleaner and use the brush to scrob. Flush the toilet. Use a damp cloth with allpurpose cleaner to wipe the seat. Use a dry cloth to dry the surfaces.
outputs.general-quick-hallway: In the hallway, vacuum the floors and the doormat.
outputs.general-thorough-hallway: In the hallway, declutter and clean up all non-essential objects. Vacuum the floor, smash the mat. You can use a mop to clean out the spiderwebs.
outputs.carpet-no-stain: Vacuum the carpet. If your vacuum has a special brush for the carpet, it is wise to use that. Otherwise you can take the nozzle off.
outputs.floor-tiles-no-stain: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.marble-floor-no-stain: Vacuum the floor and then mop the floor using allpurpose cleaner.
outputs.laminate-flooring-no-stain: Vacuum the floor using a soft brush, then mop using a damp mop, not too wet. There is special laminate cleaner to use. If you don't have this, you can use allpurpose cleaner for mopping.
outputs.wall-tiles-no-stain: Use a damp cloth with allpurpose cleaner.
outputs.fabric-furniture-no-stain: Use a vacuum cleaner for the couch. There are special brushes for this. If you do not have this, consider not using a nozzle.
outputs.leather-furniture-no-stain: Use a damp cloth and make sure to clean the surface frequently. There is also special leather grease to use which can be used once so often.
outputs.wood-furniture-no-stain: It is possible to use a special wood oil to treat the wood. Otherwise, use a damp cloth.
outputs.metal-furniture-no-stain: Use a damp cloth with a glass cleaner and then a dry cloth.
outputs.glass-furniture-no-stain: Use a damp cloth with a glass cleaner and then a dry cloth.
outputs.plastic-furniture-no-stain: Use a damp cloth with all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth.
outputs.carpet-oil: First dap the stain with a kitchen cloth. Then use a wet cloth with degreaser or dish soap. Rub with a brush until the stain is removed. Then use a dry cloth to dry the carpet. If the stain is not removed, use some scissors to cut the stain out or consider buying a new carpet. If none of these are options for you, you can consider putting furniture on top of the stain.
outputs.floor-tiles-oil: First use a kitchen cloth to let it soak up the oil. Then use a wet cloth with degreaser, dish soap or hot water with degreaser. Then use a dry cloth to dry the floor.
outputs.wood-floor-oil: If the floor is untreated, consider using a saw to remove the stain. Otherwise, if the stain remained on top use a kitchen cloth to remove the oil. Then use a wet cloth with degreaser, dish soap or hot water with degreaser. Then use a dry cloth to dry the floor.
outputs.marble-floor-oil: Use a mop with hot water and degreaser. Then use a dry cloth to dry the floor.
outputs.laminate-flooring-oil: Use a damp mop with lukewarm water. Then use a dry cloth to dry the floor.
outputs.wall-tiles-oil: Use a kitchen cloth to rub the stain. If it is not removed, you may use a damp cloth with degreaser or dish soap to remove it. Dry the wall with a dry cloth.
outputs.paint-wall-oil: Use a kitchen cloth to dab the stain. If it is not removed, you may use a damp cloth with degreaser or dish soap to remove it. Dry the wall with a dry cloth.
outputs.wooden-wall-oil: Use a kitchen cloth to rub remove the stain. If it is not removed, you may use a damp cloth with degreaser or dish soap to remove it. Dry the wall with a dry cloth.
outputs.brick-wall-oil: Use a kitchen cloth to dab the stain.
outputs.fabric-furniture-oil: You can use a kitchen cloth remove the excess oil. Try using dishs soap on a wet cloth to try and remove the stain. Dry the furniture with a dry cloth.
outputs.leather-furniture-oil: Use a kitchen cloth to rub the stain. If it is not removed, try using a little bit of dish soap. Dry the furniture with a dry cloth.
outputs.wood-furniture-oil: Try to rub the stain into the furniture, it is possible that it will not be seen anymore.
outputs.metal-furniture-oil: Use a kitchen cloth to rub the stain. Dry the furniture with a dry cloth.
outputs.glass-furniture-oil: First use degreaser to remove it. Then use glass cleaner to remove the degreaser. Let it air dry.
outputs.plastic-furniture-oil: Use a kitchen cloth to dab the stain. Then you can use dish soap to remove excess oil. Dry the furniture with a dry cloth.
outputs.carpet-blood: Dab the stain with cloth and cold water. You can use a brush if necessary. If possible, let it soak in cold water for a while. Then use a dry cloth to dry the carpet. If the stain is not removed, use some scissors to cut the stain out or consider buying a new carpet. If none of these are options for you, you can consider putting furniture on top of the stain.
outputs.floor-tiles-blood: Use a cloth to soak up the blood. Then you may use a warm cloth to clean it up. Then use a dry cloth to dry the floor.
outputs.wood-floor-blood: Remove it as quickly as possible using a cold wet cloth. Then use a dry cloth to dry the floor.
outputs.marble-floor-blood: Use a cloth to soak up the blood. Then you may use a warm cloth to clean it up. Then use a dry cloth to dry the floor.
outputs.laminate-flooring-blood: Use a cloth to soak up the blood. Then you may use a warm cloth to clean it up. Then use a dry cloth to dry the floor.
outputs.wallpaper-blood: Dab the stain with a cloth soaked in cold water and then wipe with a dry cloth
outputs.wall-tiles-blood: Dab the stain with a cloth soaked in cold water and then wipe with a dry cloth
outputs.paint-wall-blood: Dab the stain with a cloth soaked in cold water and then wipe with a dry cloth
outputs.wooden-wall-blood: Dab the stain with a cloth soaked in cold water and then wipe with a dry cloth
outputs.brick-wall-blood: Dab the stain with a cloth soaked in cold water and then wipe with a dry cloth
outputs.fabric-furniture-blood: Dab the stain with a cloth soaked in cold water and then wipe with a dry cloth
outputs.leather-furniture-blood: Use a wet cloth and make sure to clean the surface frequently
outputs.wood-furniture-blood: Use a wet cloth and then dry the furniture immediately
outputs.metal-furniture-blood: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.glass-furniture-blood: Use a wet cloth with cleaning vinegar and then a dry cloth
outputs.plastic-furniture-blood: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.carpet-dust: Vacuum the carpet. If your vacuum has a special brush for the carpet, it is wise to use that. Otherwise you can take the nozzle off.
outputs.laminate-flooring-dust: Vacuum the floor, use a soft brush.
outputs.wallpaper-dust: You can use a duster to remove the dust.
outputs.wall-tiles-dust: You can use a wet cloth to remove the dust. You may use allpurpose cleaner.
outputs.paint-wall-dust: You can use a duster to remove the dust.
outputs.wooden-wall-dust: You can use a duster to remove the dust.
outputs.brick-wall-dust: You can try to use a broom to remove the dust from the brick wall.
outputs.fabric-furniture-dust: Use a vacuum with a small nozzle.
outputs.leather-furniture-dust: Use a damp cloth to remove the dust.
outputs.wood-furniture-dust: Use a vacuum cleaner to remove the dust.
outputs.metal-furniture-dust: Use a damp cloth to remove the dust. You can also use glass cleaner as it will leave no streaks.
outputs.glass-furniture-dust: Use a damp cloth to remove the dust. You can also use glass cleaner as it will leave no streaks.
outputs.plastic-furniture-dust: Use a damp cloth to remove the dust.
outputs.carpet-ink: There might be ink remover available for your carpet. Otherwise, if the stain is not removeable, use some scissors to cut the stain out or consider buying a new carpet. If none of these are options for you, you can consider putting furniture on top of the stain.
outputs.floor-tiles-ink: Use a warm weth cloth to remove the stain.
outputs.wood-floor-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.marble-floor-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.laminate-flooring-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wallpaper-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wall-tiles-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.paint-wall-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wooden-wall-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.brick-wall-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.fabric-furniture-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.leather-furniture-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wood-furniture-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.metal-furniture-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.glass-furniture-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.plastic-furniture-ink: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.carpet-liquid-food: First try to get most of the food off using a spoon. Then, use a wet cloth to dab the stain. Then use a dry cloth to dry the carpet.
outputs.floor-tiles-liquid-food: Use a kitchen cloth to remove it. If it is sticky, then use a warm wet cloth to remove it. Finish by using a dry towel to dry the tiles.
outputs.wood-floor-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.marble-floor-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.laminate-flooring-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wallpaper-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wall-tiles-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.paint-wall-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wooden-wall-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.brick-wall-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.fabric-furniture-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.leather-furniture-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wood-furniture-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.metal-furniture-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.glass-furniture-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.plastic-furniture-liquid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.carpet-solid-food: Vacuum the carpet. If your vacuum has a special brush for the carpet, it is wise to use that. Otherwise you can take the nozzle off. You may aso use a crumble thief.
outputs.floor-tiles-solid-food: Use a broom and dustpan to remove the food.
outputs.wood-floor-solid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.marble-floor-solid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.laminate-flooring-solid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wallpaper-solid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wall-tiles-solid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.paint-wall-solid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wooden-wall-solid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.brick-wall-solid-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.fabric-furniture-solid-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.leather-furniture-solid-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.wood-furniture-solid-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.metal-furniture-solid-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.glass-furniture-solid-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.plastic-furniture-solid-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.carpet-mixed-food: First use a spoon to get most of the food off the carpet. Then dab the stain with a damp cloth. Then use a dry cloth to dry the carpet.
outputs.floor-tiles-mixed-food: Use some kitchen cloths to remove everything. You can finish by using a wet cloth to remove the rest. Then use a dry cloth to dry the floor.
outputs.wood-floor-mixed-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.marble-floor-mixed-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.laminate-flooring-mixed-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wallpaper-mixed-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wall-tiles-mixed-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.paint-wall-mixed-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.wooden-wall-mixed-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.brick-wall-mixed-food: Use a wet cloth with an all purpose cleaner and then a dry cloth
outputs.fabric-furniture-mixed-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.leather-furniture-mixed-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.wood-furniture-mixed-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.metal-furniture-mixed-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.glass-furniture-mixed-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.plastic-furniture-mixed-food: Use a vacuum cleaner and then a damp cloth
outputs.water: Use a dry cloth to wipe the surface. Then, let it dry. Do not try to use a hair dryer or fan to dry the surface. This might result in a burn stain and unfortunately, our program does not account for burn stains.
outputs.animal-hair: Use a vacuum cleaner and rubber gloves to remove the hair
outputs.glass: Remove the large pieces carefully from the surface. Then, use a vacuum cleaner to remove the small pieces. You can check whether you have removed all the pieces by using a flashlight. Finally, if an an additional substance is left, you can reset and start again with the new substance.
